biological_system: Human sweet taste receptor (GPCR), heterodimerized with TAS1R3 in the VFT domain; expressed in taste receptor cells and heterologous systems (e.g., HEK293)
desired_modulation: Agonism or partial agonism (sweet perception activation)
corresponding_assay: Cell-based calcium flux assay (co-expression of TAS1R2/TAS1R3 with Gα16 or Gαgustducin); alternatively cAMP or IP₃ reporter assays
rationale: TAS1R2 contains the primary orthosteric binding determinants for many sweet ligands; agonist-induced activation correlates with perceived sweetness intensity

biological_system: Human sweet taste receptor co-receptor; obligate heterodimer partner of TAS1R2
desired_modulation: Positive modulation / co-agonism; structural stabilization of active heterodimer
corresponding_assay: Same calcium flux or reporter assay as above; optional mutagenesis-assisted functional assays
metric_used: EC₅₀ shift, Emax modulation, Δresponse vs TAS1R2 alone
rationale: TAS1R3 is required for receptor assembly, signaling competence, and ligand-dependent conformational change; modulation enhances or enables TAS1R2-driven activation
